entry.title: Technical user creation in Identity Service for implementing CI/CD ? (no email)
entry.content:
Hello,

The good practice for CI/CD is to use a technical user : "Use a technical user instead of your personal credentials. For more information, see Credential Handling. See Creating Credentials." (source).

I configured a custom Identity Provider (SAP Identity Services) to the cloud foundry sub-account. But, in the Identity Services, a valid email is required to configure the password... What is the proper way to create a technical user for CI/CD without an email (a password or a certificate valid for several months) ?

SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery SAP Cloud Identity Services SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment 

Thank you

Yann

entry.title: Re: Doubts about using the API
entry.content:
Buenas tardes,

Al intentar contabilizar el abono tal y como indicáis con el parámetro SupplierInvoiceIsCreditMemo = "True" el sistema devuelve un error de lectura de dicho parámetro.

La cabecera del json es la siguiente:

{
  "d" : {
    "CompanyCode" : "0600",
    "SuplrInvcDebitCrdtCodeReturns": "S",
    "SupplierInvoiceIsCreditMemo": true ,
    "DocumentDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
    "PostingDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
    "SupplierInvoiceIDByInvcgParty" : "Test12",
    "InvoicingParty" : "1001260",
    "DocumentCurrency" : "EUR",
    "InvoiceGrossAmount" : "121",
    "DueCalculationBaseDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
    "TaxIsCalculatedAutomatically" : true,
    "TaxDeterminationDate" : "2025-08-19T00:00",
 
Sin embargo nos devuelve el error: "Failed to read property 'SupplierInvoiceIsCreditMemo' at offset '121'" hemos comprobado que la estructura del json es la correcta, ¿Pueden indicarnos si debemos de pasar algún parámetro más o indicarnos donde se encuentra el error?

entry.title: Switching Your Tax Procedure or External Tax Provider (United States Sales and Use Tax)
entry.content:
To state the obvious: Getting your taxes right is an important part of your business, and it’s not an area where you’d typically seek out additional complexities.

This is the shortest possible version of why it’s difficult to change your sales and use tax procedure in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Your tax procedure is something you set up in your initial scoping, and it is in most cases the deepest asleep of all of your sleeping dogs. Almost all the time, you just want to leave it alone.

Almost. There are times when you need to make a change. Perhaps your business structure has changed sufficiently that you want to move from the internal tax calculation procedure to the external and join up with a tax partner. Or maybe you need to switch tax partners.

In these cases, with live systems, you need to think carefully, plan for disruption, think again, and plan some more. And then probably do that one more time. Then if you’re going ahead, consult our KBA entitled Information on the Internal Tax Calculation Procedure (TAXUSJ) to the External Tax Calculation Procedure (0TXUSX) for more detailed information on the procedure, risks, and potential downtimes associated with such a switch.

entry.title: Re: When consuming a BW query through an import connectio...
entry.content:
@govardhan_vegi98 

As you have created the import model based on the query, the filters will only be available in the model query which will just filter the data flowing to the this import model. The story based on this import model is like a normal story based on a import model which will not have any filters of the original BW query.

If it was live model based on BW query you might have got the filters in the story.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: What do I do to enable the values of an application t...
entry.content:
Hi @cassio_amparo,

In the app: F4603, you can view the costs in the graph when pointing out with the mouse. You can play around with the filters and "view by" option so you can see the costs per order.

 

If you want the cost values to actually show up on the graph, you’ll probably need to build a custom analytical report or use another app like Actual Cost Analysis (F3567), which gives a bit more flexibility with charts.

Another simple option is to export the data to Excel and create your own chart there with the numbers displayed.

Best regards,

Luisa

entry.title: Importing Master data for SAP_FI_FPA_IM_S4_Finance_Planning
entry.content:
Subject: Unable to Load Dimension SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT from S/4HANA Public Cloud into SAC Planning

We are facing an issue when trying to load master data into the SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT dimension in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning, using the pre-delivered Financial Planning Business Content.

System Setup

  • SAP Analytics Cloud: Business Content – Financial Planning

  • Backend system: S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Connection type: Import connection to S/4HANA Public Cloud

  • Target Dimension: SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT

  • Query Used: A_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts

  • Model Used: SAP Finance (Financial) XP&A - Corp FP&A - Rapid Finance Planning & Analysis for SAP S/4HANA - ver 4 (2505 - May 2025)

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Deploy SAC Planning Financial Planning Business Content.

  2. Establish import connection to S/4HANA Public Cloud.

  3. Open Model → Dimension SAP_XPA_ACCOUNT → Import Data.

  4. Select connection to S/4HANA and choose query A_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts.

  5. Run data validation → no errors are detected.

  6. Execute data load.

Actual Result

  • Data load fails every time without a detailed error message.

  • Correlation ID: 1591349937304846b048723149393756

Expected Result

  • Dimension members should be successfully loaded from S/4HANA into SAC Planning.

entry.title: Re: Vendor Clearing Based on PO
entry.content:
The vendor line item in FI doesn’t automatically inherit the PO number unless it's explicitly passed during posting. Even if you’ve set the sort key in the vendor master or GL account master to include the PO number (I presume, you set the sort key 014), it only works if the PO number is available in the document at the time of posting. In advance payments, the PO number is often not entered or linked unless manually added to the assignment field.

In order to enable PO-based clearing in F-44, when posting the advance payment and invoice, manually enter the PO number in the assignment field (ZUONR). This ensures both line items carry the same reference and can be matched in F-44.

If you want this to happen without manual entry, then yes, an enhancement like BAdI FIMA_ASSIGNMENT or User exit in SAPMF05A can be used to fetch the PO number from the related logistics document and populate the assignment field on the vendor line item during posting.

entry.title: From Hype to Reality: AI Discovery Workshop in SAP Serialization Life Sciences
entry.content:
Big Ideas begin with small sketches

 

Over the past decade, serialization has become a cornerstone for ensuring compliance, traceability, and supply chain integrity, particularly in industries like pharmaceuticals, life sciences, and consumer goods. As regulations grow more complex and data volumes increase, the need for intelligent, automated insights within serialization processes has never been clearer.

That’s why we recently conducted an AI Discovery Workshop focused on SAP’s Serialization solution, bringing together cross-functional teams from over 17 largest companies in the US to explore how Artificial Intelligence can elevate serialization from a compliance tool into a strategic business enabler.

🔍 Why Focus on AI in Serialization?

SAP Serialization solutions provide rich, structured data - batch numbers, production line metrics, event histories, and global traceability records. This makes them an ideal foundation for AI-driven innovation.

During the workshop, we explored several high-impact use cases, including:

  • Predictive Exception Management – Flagging anomalies in serial number generation, shipping delays, or partner reporting issues.
  • Intelligent Root Cause Analysis – Using AI to trace deviations or failures back to specific batches, suppliers, or production events.
  • Smart Data handling – Automating error detection in serial number hierarchies across complex supply networks.

🧠 Leveraging the SAP AppHaus Approach for AI Innovation

A key differentiator of this workshop was running a Business AI Discovery Workshop, facilitated by @AmirBonakdar  from the SAP AppHaus. Grounded in SAP’s proven human-centered innovation methodology, this approach ensured we:

  • Empathized with serialization users — from supply chain managers to compliance officers — to uncover unmet needs and pain points.
  • Defined clear problem statements rooted in business impact.
  • Co-created practical AI use cases that are both technically feasible and truly valuable for end users.

💡 Workshop Insights: Beyond Compliance, Unlocking Real Business Value

  • Exception Management is a High-Impact Starting Point:
    Serialization data often surfaces numerous exceptions - missing serial numbers, shipment inconsistencies, or data input errors - that require manual investigation. The workshop highlighted how AI-driven predictive exception management can dramatically reduce manual effort by automatically flagging high-risk issues before they escalate, improving operational efficiency and reducing costly delays.
  • Value Extends Well Beyond Regulatory Compliance:
    While compliance remains fundamental, participants recognized serialization data as a rich source for strategic analytics. By leveraging AI, organizations can gain deeper supply chain visibility, optimize inventory flows, and enhance supplier collaboration - delivering tangible cost savings and customer satisfaction improvements.
  • Analytics as a Foundation for Continuous Improvement:
    Real-time AI-powered analytics dashboards and alerts emerged as essential tools for driving ongoing process improvements. The ability to detect trends, identify recurring root causes, and monitor compliance dynamically equips decision-makers with actionable insights to proactively mitigate risks.

👣 What’s Next?

We’re exploring pilot initiatives, both focused on intelligent exception handling and traceability assistants. The goal is to improve operational agility and compliance confidence while laying the foundation for more advanced AI capabilities.

If you’re working with serialization in SAP and wondering how to take the next step with AI, I’d be happy to share more or connect you with the right resources.

Let’s move beyond compliance - and into intelligence.

SAP Information Collaboration Hub for Life Sciences SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals

entry.title: Automatic payment block for non PO invoice
entry.content:
Hello

We have this requirement.

We want to have invoice approval workflow for all supplier invoices posted without PO (what we call FI invoice) and also for PO related invoices (MM invoices) if there is a price/quantity difference. We post our invoice with [Create supplier invoice]

To trigger the flexible workflow for blocked supplier invoice, the invoice must be booked with a payment bock. In order to have this payment block automatically (we don't want the user to apply a payment block manually to all invoices) we use  SSCUI 104420 and SSCUI 104419 so that system set a payment block to all invoices (threshold value 0.01, percentage 99.99).

The problem is that with this settings, all invoices have a payment block, even PO invoice without price/quantity différence 

Could you advice on a customizing to have

- all invoices posted without reference to PO having an automatic payment block

- invoices related to a PO have an automatic payment block only if there is a price/quantity difference.

Thanks

entry.title: Hu is getting created for me, but i cant pack stock in it. Do you guys have any references??
Navigating SAP Commerce Cloud Bug in SmartEdit: Analysis and Solutions
entry.content:
What's Happening?

After upgrading, you might find that canceling edits on nested components leads to disassociation between the component and its parent. A key line of code in the new version altered how exceptions are handled, resulting in a suppressed error that inadvertently sets components to null. This particular issue started impacting systems on July 3, 2025, and affects primary business processes without any immediate workaround.

How to Identify the Issue

Here’s how you can reproduce and identify this behavior in your environment:

  1. Advanced Editing
    Edit a page using the "Advance Edit" feature.
  2. Accessing Components
    Open a component on the page that includes a cmsLink or similar object.
  3. Nested Modals
    Click to open the cmsLink or object, which will display a nested modal.
  4. Cancel Without Changes
    Click "Cancel" without making any modifications. Notice the cmsLink is no longer linked to its parent component.

Why Does This Happen?

This issue originated from a code change in version 2211.41. The update altered exception handling, causing the system to suppress errors that previously prevented the component from being nullified. As a result, UI data integrity is compromised, potentially leading to negative effects on the user experience if deployed into production.

How Can You Fix It?

We're actively addressing this bug, and a fix is scheduled to roll out with SAP Commerce Cloud version 2211.43. In the interim, we recommend:

Temporary Workaround: Although the front-end appears to disconnect the link, it remains in the backend. By canceling and reopening the editor for the parent component, the link should reappear, preserving the user experience.

Conclusion

Managing component associations in SAP Commerce Cloud is crucial for maintaining website functionality. While awaiting the full fix, leveraging the temporary workaround ensures your operations continue unimpeded. For further assistance or guidance, don’t hesitate to contact SAP Support—we're committed to helping you resolve this issue promptly!
Optimize your workflow with these insights, and stay tuned for updates. We're here to support your success with SAP Commerce Cloud!

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Extended Environment Access Level Functionality
entry.content:
Hi Dear Community Members!

Previously in the blogpost SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Introducing the Environment Access Management Screen we introduced you to Environment Access Management (EAM) Screen where administrators can set an environment access level security to control the visibility to their environments by setting them as either “Public” or “Private” which ensures that only authorized users have access to it.

To unlock its full potential, SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) is glad to announce the extended environment access level functionality where administrators can now start setting the environment access level from Environment Screen (Main) and Content Management. in this blogpost, I will walk you through the steps on how to do it from Creation, Editing, and even Copying of an environment to setting environment access level when importing a content to your tenant.

Before we proceed, it is important to take note that admin users must have the ENVIRONMENTS_ACCESS_ALL role which will play a crucial part in this extended functionality.

Let’s get started!

In the Environment and Content Management screens, we know that to manage environments your user must have at least the ENVIRONMENTS and CONTENTS role.

But now, if your user has a combined role ENVIRONMENTS_ACCESS_ALL, you will have this additional Access option.

Although this access option is comparable to what is presently available on the EAM screen, you can now define an environment to be either public or private and assign authorized teams from the moment it is created, edited, copied, or imported.

Create a private environment

  1. In the environment screen choose Add button
  2. Choose Environment
  3. In the Add Environment window, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Description
  4. In Access, by default public is chosen in this option but if you switch to Private, as an admin you will be able to choose and assign the Teams that will be authorized to see and access this environment.
  5. Then choose Add

Edit a public environment to private

  1. In the environment screen choose your environment
  2. Choose Edit
  3. In the Edit Environment window, choose the access level as Private  
  4. Choose the Authorized Teams
  5. Then choose Edit

Note: Private environments can also be edited as public, just choose Public in access.

Copy a public environment as private

  1. In the environment screen choose your environment
  2. Choose Add button, then choose Environment from
  3. In the Copy Environment window, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Description
  4. In Access, by default public is chosen in this option but if you switch to Private, as an admin you will be able to choose and assign the Teams that will be authorized to see and access this environment.
  5. Then choose Copy

Note: Private environments can also be copied as another private environment and the admin will have an option to either retain or change the assigned authorized teams.

Now, let’s take a look in Content Management screen. First thing that you will notice is a new column called Access which indicates if an environment in the list is public or private.

Let us understand how import works with this environment access level functionality!

Import a public environment and make it as private

  1. In the Content Management, choose the content that you want to import
  2. Choose Import button
  3. In the Import Environment, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Activate: Yes/No
    4. In the Access, choose Private
    5. Assign the Authorized Teams
  4. Then choose Import as New

Note: Private environments can also be imported as public, just choose Public in access.

But, what if you export a private environment with teams assigned to it? What will happen if you import this environment to a target tenant? Let’s answer that in the next scenarios.

  • Import a private environment with Team existing in both Source and Target tenants
  • Import a private environment with Team existing from Source but not existing in Target tenant

Import a private environment with Team existing in both Source and Target tenants

  1. In the Content Management, choose the content that you want to import
  2. Choose Import button
  3. In the Import Environment, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Activate: Yes/No
    4. In the Access, automatically this will be set as Private
    5. Assign or Unassign the Authorized Teams
  4. Then choose Import as New

Note: In the Authorized Teams, admin will have an option to either retain, change, or add more teams.

Import a private environment with Team existing from Source but not existing in Target tenant

  1. In the Content Management, choose the content that you want to import
  2. Choose Import button
  3. Create Missing Teams: Yes/No
  4. In the Import Environment, maintain the following:
    1. Environment ID
    2. Environment Version
    3. Activate: Yes/No
    4. In the Access, automatically this will be set as Private
    5. Assign or Unassign the Authorized Teams
  5. Then choose Import as New

Note: The system will either create the missing teams if the teams that are currently assigned in the environment that will be imported are present in the target tenant. The administrator must then assign the users in the created team as users are not importable due to different team composition is different tenants. Or, totally not include the team in the import if Create Missing Teams = No.

Now, if you have gone through or already read the blogpost, SAP PaPM Cloud SM: Introducing the Environment Access Management Screen you should already know the conditions and expected result when an environment is created or imported as private which is explained in two (2) different scenarios with Privileged Role Access and Authorized Team Membership Granting Access.

That’s it! I hope the examples provided in this blogpost are able to show you the things that you need to know about the extended Environment Access Level Functionality. Now the only thing left is for you to explore. Till the next new features from SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model. Enjoy!

entry.title: changing the label count in the app Enter Time Ticket for Production Order (CO11N)
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts, 

in a S/4 HANA public cloud envorinment we have the following topic, Maybe one of you have an idea?:

Issue:
We want to able to change the label count of time ticket for production order.

Process:
In the app “Enter Time Ticket for Production Order(CO11N)”, with the production order and confirm type selected as “Final Confirmation”, time ticket is created and labels are starts printing.

Try outs:
We added a custom field to app to able able to enter label count(Screenshot2). We searched for a way to give that data to BADI’s.

CO11N is calling Migo in background and that we cannot pass the custom Label Field (Screenshot 1) to the standard label field and set the checkbox for the printing

We have looked for these BADI’s;

  • BD_WORKORDER_GOODSMOVT_BKF_GDR
  • FLOG_CHG_GR_DATA
  • MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA
  • MMIM_HEAD_PROVIDE_DATA

 

In some of these BADI’s we found “number of labels to be printed” in their importing parameters but we require it to be in their changing parameters.

entry.title: Re: How Can I transfer data from One client to another /s...
entry.content:
Hello @sonia260165 

The data is kept in the /SCWM/STADET_OUT which has delivery class = A (master and application data)

The standard way is manual maintenance in the destination system.

If you are savvy transport system, you can add /SCWM/STADET_OUT entries manually to a transport with R3TR TABU object. Be sure to know what you are doing, if you chose this option.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Hu is getting created for me, but i cant pack stock i...
entry.content:
When you create a discussion and expecting some inputs from this forum, please see that you create the discussion with as much information as possible so that, it will be easy for the members to understand the issue. You have not even added the issue in the text. Just by reading the subject alone is not suffice to assist you.

In order to understand better whether it is because of process issue or configuration issue, please clarify the following:

  • Are you working in an outbound or inbound delivery because, the packing logic differs between the two.
  • Is the HU created manually or automatically during the process? This will determine if it is a config or process issue.
  • What error message you were getting when trying to pack the stock ? Please share a screen shot of that error message
  • Is the material HU-managed in the material master?

entry.title: Re: oDataService Request is called multiple times
entry.content:
Hi AnilTripathy, As I guess in your controller check below statement is there anywhere.

This.getView().getModel().refresh() or
This.getOwnerComponent.getModel().refresh()

These statements may not effect in Dev environment some times because of oData model versions,
in higher environments, Some cases I have observed issue with these statements.

Resolution:
Handle them with Named model refresh in controllers.

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Suite – Access Policies for Integration Packages

entry.title: Re: Skipping popup messages in VA03 for Sales Order Incom...
entry.content:
To reduce unnecessary popups, you need to identify and remove fields from the incompletion procedure that:

  • are not essential for your business process
  • Do not impact downstream activities (like delivery, billing, or reporting)

This way, SAP won’t flag those fields as incomplete, and users won’t be bombarded with popups.

Needless to mention, SAP does not retroactively re-evaluate open documents when you change the incompletion procedure. That means documents already flagged as incomplete will remain incomplete until manually edited or reprocessed.

entry.title: Re: Automatic payment block for non PO invoice
entry.content:
To meet your requirements:

  • avoid global SSCUI SSCUI 104420 and 104419 thresholds. They’re too blunt.
  • Use Flexible Workflow (WS00800251) conditions to differentiate invoice types. The condition can be Purchase Order Reference = Empty for FI invoices. For MM invoices, use Condition Invoice Block Reason = Price/Quantity Variance.
  • Implement BAdI logic via MRM_PAYMENT_BLOCK to apply payment blocks only when needed.
  • Optionally use validation rules via OB28, for FI invoices to enforce the payment block. This works well for FI invoices posted via FB60 or Fiori apps

entry.title: SAP API Management - APIKey and Response Caching
entry.content:
Introduction :

What is Caching ?

In API Management, response caching allows us to deliver much faster responses to users by storing the results of repeated requests in the cache. This way, the backend doesn’t need to be invoked for every request, reducing unnecessary load on the system. As a result, performance increases, latency decreases, and backend resources are utilized more efficiently.

Scenario :

Caching doesn’t always mean storing the entire dataset. With query parameters, we can cache only the specific results that users request. In this scenario, the user makes an API call by defining certain conditions through query parameters, and the system responds faster by serving the cached result that matches those conditions.

Step 1: Create API Proxy 

Configure --> APIs --> API Proxies --> Create

Note : The first step is usually to create an API provider; however, in my proxy I will not be using a provider. Instead, I will connect to the backend system directly via its URL.

Step 2: Create Product

Engage--> Products --> Create

It’s not mandatory to create a product for every process; however, since we want the user to trigger our API with an API key, we need to create a product.

If we want, we can set quotas for our APIs. This is something we can define ourselves. For example, in this case I am adding a rule that allows up to 100 requests to this API within 10 months.

Step 3: Create Application

I am connecting to the Developer Hub from the Integration Suite screen. And I can see the products I created earlier.

Workspace --> Create

 

 

In this way, we have created an application key linked to this product.

Step 4: Policies

We create API proxies to manage aspects such as security, performance, and routing. These controls are implemented through policies.

In this scenario, I implemented the user’s access to the API via an API key, as well as the caching process, through policies.

VerifyAPIKey: 

With this policy, we define the rule that allows access only if the user includes the API key created in the Developer Hub within the request header.

<VerifyAPIKey async='true' continueOnError='false' enabled='true' 
xmlns='http://www.sap.com/apimgmt'>
<APIKey ref='request.header.x-api-key'/>
</VerifyAPIKey>

Caching:

I don’t necessarily have to specify a query, but I used it here to make the scenario more specific. Users may not always send requests without queries, and this needs to be taken into account. Therefore, you can use any query parameters you wish to include.

I set the caching duration to 3600 seconds.

<ResponseCache async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" xmlns="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">
<CacheKey>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$filter"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$select"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$top"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$expand"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.queryparam.$skip"/>
<KeyFragment ref="request.path"/>
</CacheKey>
<Scope>Exclusive</Scope>
<ExpirySettings>
<TimeoutInSec>3600</TimeoutInSec>
</ExpirySettings>

</ResponseCache>

 

So how can I tell whether the data is coming from the cache or from the backend system? I previously mentioned that the purpose of caching is to return responses faster. When you trigger the API from Postman or any other system, you can check the response time. We will test this in the next step. Additionally, you can add a JavaScript code to your policy. If the timestamp does not change, you can conclude that the data was served from the cache.

 

var response = context.getVariable("response.content");

var serverTime = new Date().toISOString();

var updatedResponse = serverTime+response


context.setVariable("response.content", updatedResponse);

 

Note: Since the other policies are related to the authentication of the service I want to access, I will not cover them here in order to stay on topic and avoid confusion. I will write a separate blog post about authentication policies in API Management. 

For that reason, I will not go into the get token and set token steps.

Step 5 : Testing

As shown in the two test cases below, I can retrieve data from the API using the API key parameter sent in the request header. The first example is the initial call to the backend system, with a response time of 4.09 seconds. The second example returns the same query from the cache rather than the backend, with a response time of 431 ms.

 

Summary :

Response caching delivers faster response times—improving user experience, especially for mobile users—while lowering backend load on SAP Graph or other backend systems. It also drives cost savings by avoiding redundant calls to pay-per-use services, increases API-quota efficiency by preventing rate-limit hits from repeated queries, and improves stability by allowing responses to continue even during backend outages.

Thank you.

Deniz.

entry.title: Re: SD document 212345 is not in the database or has been...
entry.content:
Since you have confirmed that the issue is only with one material, couple of options are there which you can explore. They are

  • After saving the order, go to transaction SM13, look for update records related to the user and time of the failed order. If you see a status like “Update Terminated”, click into the record to view the error details.
  • Even if the user doesn’t see a dump, the system might log one. So go to ST22 and filter by date/user. Look for dumps like UPDATE_FAILED, OBJECTS_OBJREF_NOT_ASSIGNED, or custom Z-program errors.
  • Use SLG1 with object SD or VA and subobject ORDER. This can reveal hidden errors or messages that didn’t surface in the UI.
  • Most importantly, since the issue is material specific, I doubt, some custom validation should be there. So, create a sale order again with the problematic material in debug mode, after setting a break-point in MV45AFZZ. If the system does not stop at any value, then, you need to find out which other custom exit is there for material specific. This you can get via SE11, where you input MATNR and click on Where-Used list. This will show all user exits.

entry.title: SAP Maintenance Assistant 2508 Now Available – What’s New?
entry.content:
The SAP Mobile Asset Management team is excited to announce the 2508 release of SAP Maintenance Assistant, the mobile app for maintenance execution with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This update continues our focus on making technicians more effective in the field — with new form capabilities and expanded integration with SAP Field Service Management (FSM).

Features delivered in the 2408 release

SAP Dynamic Forms on Mobile

SAP Dynamic Forms is now available directly in SAP Maintenance Assistant. Built on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), Dynamic Forms let organizations design digital forms with validation rules, attach them to business objects, and make them available to technicians both online and offline.

On the mobile app, technicians can:

  • Download forms with their assigned work,
  • Save drafts as they go,
  • Submit completed forms once work is finished.

Forms sync back to SAP BTP where data can be mapped to business objects or trigger follow-up actions.

Administration for Dynamic Forms

On the backend, administrators now have ways to manage Dynamic Forms:

  • Dynamic Forms Administration – New Fiori tiles allow configuration and assignment of Dynamic Forms to relevant business objects.
  • Manage Mobile Application Configuration – Introduces new options to configure Dynamic Form Agents which are responsible for handling form operations for a specific business object type.

Expanding the Field Service Technician Persona

In our previous release, we introduced the Field Service Technician persona. With 2508, we’re expanding its capabilities by integrating more deeply with FSM, giving technicians visibility into dispatcher-assigned work and structured service scripts.

FSM Smartform Support

When an FSM dispatcher assigns an activity with a Smartform, the form now appears directly in the Maintenance Assistant item details. Technicians can work through these structured, multi-step scripts to capture inspection results, safety checks, notes, and more — ensuring consistent execution across the field.

FSM Activity and Status Integration

With FSM integration enabled:

  • Activities – Items released by the dispatcher in the FSM Planning & Dispatching Board appear in Maintenance Assistant after sync.
  • Status Updates – Technician updates made in the app are sent back to FSM, so dispatchers always see real-time progress.
  • Location Data – When enabled, the technician’s location syncs back to FSM, helping planners make informed dispatching decisions.

Release available now

SAP Maintenance Assistant is available now. The application is publicly available and includes an offline demo mode for viewing and testing the functionality. The application may be downloaded from the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.

Submit innovation requests

We encourage you to visit the SAP Mobile Service and Asset Management Customer Influence portal to submit improvement requests. Use the SAP Maintenance Assistant for S/4HANA Public Cloud category to properly direct your request.

Explore other SAP mobile applications

SAP has a powerful suite of SAP native mobile applications. Follow the MXE Community for latest updates.

entry.title: Webinar: How SAP partners deliver new countries in SAP Cloud ERP with the CLT
entry.content:
SAP is pleased to announce a dedicated session on the Configuration Localization Tool (CLT), now generally available. This tool marks a significant step forward in enabling localization as a self-service, allowing partners and customers to deliver country- and region-specific compliance where no standard SAP-delivered local version exists.

CLT provides a structured, scalable, and partner-ready framework that simplifies the creation of local compliance content. With this tool, partners can support customers in expanding their geographic footprint efficiently and reliably—unlocking new market opportunities with minimal overhead.

This session is designed for:

  • Localization experts seeking to extend SAP solutions to new regions
  • Implementation partners looking to deliver tailored compliance content
  • Business development leads exploring untapped markets

Participants will gain practical insights into how CLT supports SAP’s strategic globalization agenda and how to leverage it effectively in real-world scenarios.

Session 1: 09:00 AM CET - 10:30 AM CET
Session 2: 04:00 PM CET - 05:30 PM CET

The agenda and registration link are available here.

entry.title: Re: Succession Org Chart Reporting
entry.content:
Hi @Sue-Lhymn,

You could create a report which includes the various fields you would like to see, along with the current nominations attached to the position.

You could then schedule the report to be ran prior to each time their position sync process is ran.

This would then allow you to review the position structure and nominations which existed in the system at the time before the position sync job ran. 

Note: The data would be in a table format and would not be an image like the Succession Org Chart

Thanks,

Michael
